channel.title: Decent system monitor?
channel.description:
Can anyone give me the names of a few decent system monitors, I've currently got conky and I personally don't like it much at all. If you wish to know, my distro is Sabayon 3.4 (Not updating to 4.1 because of usage of Entropy), and I'm running KDE 3.5 currently.
I've thought about using Torsmo, but I've not seen anything about it that I can base reasoning on.
Thanks.

item.title: Decent system monitor?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:12, topic:283384”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=374481.msg2824216#msg2824216 date=1244853169]

why does that one use entropy?

Sabayon 4.1 introduces usage of entropy as a replacement for portage, and it’s not just that I don’t want to use entropy but with 4.1 they also introduce the usage of KDE 4.2 and it’s as standard based on the LiteMCE version of Sabayon (correct me if I’m wrong?)

Didn’t really understand your question, or fully realise if it was a meaningful question either, so I hope you got what you wanted to know / hear.
[/quote]

oh right, i thought you meant the entropy from /dev/random and /dev/urandom[/quote]

Nope, Entropy the package manager

Read full topic

Didn’t really understand your question, or fully realise if it was a meaningful question either, so I hope you got what you wanted to know / hear.[/quote]

oh right, i thought you meant the entropy from /dev/random and /dev/urandom

item.title: Decent system monitor?

item.description:

why does that one use entropy?
[/quote]

Sabayon 4.1 introduces usage of entropy as a replacement for portage, and it’s not just that I don’t want to use entropy but with 4.1 they also introduce the usage of KDE 4.2 and it’s as standard based on the LiteMCE version of Sabayon (correct me if I’m wrong?)

Didn’t really understand your question, or fully realise if it was a meaningful question either, so I hope you got what you wanted to know / hear.[/quote]
Use XFCE or Fluxbox instead? or manually install KDE 3.5
